album.name: Jane's folks visit
album.description: My folks came down for a visit and so we took some time out to explore around the area a bit more. We spent one day wandering around Brighton, getting them aclimatised to the area. We spent one day exploring Devil's Dyke, Bramber castle, Poyning and Steyning. The one rainy day of their visit we headed off to the Brighton Pavilion which was a very interesting way to spend a few hours. Then on their final day we spent some time at the Marina, before driving off along the coast through Newhaven and Seaford and then on past the Long Man of Wilmington before stopping for a wander around Lewes. All in all, a good excuse for exploring.

image.caption: Brighton Pavilion
image.description: Just an arty shot of Brighton Pavilion

image.caption: Peace statue
image.description: The Peace Statue at the border of Hove and Brighton. Taken with a bit of extra gain, hence the grainy appearance.

image.caption: Mum
image.description: She was looking at the Peace statue at the time

image.caption: Tree at Bramber Castle
image.description: I liked the light levels of this

image.caption: Mum and Dad at Bramber Castle
image.description: I know this picture is a little bit dark, but it's a really nice picture of them.

image.caption: Bramber Castle
image.description: or at least the remains of it...

image.caption: Leaves in Steyning
image.description: The White Horse Inn was covered with these leaves and looked really pretty. We made it to the pub just in time for lunch, and the food (Scampi and chips all around) was pretty good.

image.caption: Arundel Castle
image.description: A more intact castle than the one at Bramber

image.caption: Lewes war memorial
image.description: It just looked nice with the poppies laid at the base
